subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "These things I have spoken to you, that in Me you might have peace. In the world you have tribulation, but take courage, I have overcome the world." (Jn. 16:33)
reflection: Yes even a believer will have tribulations in this world. But Jesus says, "Don't be surprised when they come, but be of good cheer, I have overcome the world." He's saying, "There is nothing for you to fear." God does not give us overcoming life ~ He gives us life as we overcome. We may not always enjoy it, but the strain of life is what builds our strength. If there is no strain, there will be no strength. Have you been asking God to give you life, liberty, and joy? ~ He cannot, unless you are willing to accept the strain. Once you have faced the strain, you will immediately get the strength. Yes He says: "To him who overcomes I will give to eat from the tree of life."  ~ (Rev. 2:7) God does not give us strength for tomorrow, or for the next hour, but only for the strain of the moment. Yes a believer can "be of good cheer" even when seemingly defeated by adversity, because victory is possible in Jesus.
prayer: Dear Lord, give me the strength to face the strain of life this moment, for I know that all things are possible with You. Amen.

Gathering the twelve disciples around Him, Jesus told them,

our determination to be Christians, and our decisions for this and that, but in the New
Testament the only aspect that is brought out is the compelling purpose of God. 
"You did not choose Me, but I chose you..." (Jn. 15:16)

The work we do is of no account when compared with the compelling purpose of God.
We have not yet understood all there is to know of the compelling purpose of God...

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He took the twelve aside. (Lk. 18:31)
reflection: How often have we said, "Because so and so has some wonderful natural abilities he will make a wonderful Christian." Remember this it is not a matter of our equipment, but is a matter of our poverty; not of what we bring with us, BUT of what God puts into us; not a matter of natural virtues, of strength of character, of knowledge, or of experience, all of that is of no avail in this concern. The only thing of value is being taken into the compelling purpose of God and being made His friends (see I Cor. 1:26-31). God's friendship is with those who know their poverty. God cannot accomplish anything with the person who thinks that he is of use to God. As Christians we are not here for our own purpose ~ we are here for the purpose of God, and the two are not the same. The most important aspect of Christianity is not the work we do, but the relationship we maintain and the surrounding influence and qualities produced by that relationship. Let us not forget ~ this relationship is the one thing that is continually under attack.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to maintain a close relationship with You. Help me to fend off the attacks of Satan. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: ...and all of the things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be accomplished.'...But they understood none of those things... (Lk. 18:31, 34)
reflection: God called Jesus Christ to what seemed absolute disaster. And Jesus Christ called His disciples to see Him put to death, leading every one of them to a place where their hearts were broken. His life was an absolute failure from every standpoint except God's. But what seemed to be failure from man's standpoint was a triumph from God's standpoint, because God's purpose is never the same as Man's purpose. If we are in fellowship and oneness with God and recognize that He is taking us into His purpose, then we will no longer strive to find out what His purposes are. As we grow in the Christian life, it becomes simpler to us, because we are less inclined to say, "I wonder why God allowed this or that?" ~ And we began to see that the compelling purpose of God lies behind everything in life, and that God is divinely shaping us into oneness with that purpose. A Christian is someone who trusts in the knowledge and wisdom of God, not in his own abilities. If we have a purpose of our own, it destroys the simplicity and the calm, relaxed pace which should be characteristic of the children of God.
prayer: Dear Lord, Help me to always wait patiently on Your intended purpose. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: That holy one who is to be born will be called the Son of God. (Lk. 1:35)
reflection: If the Son of God was born into my human flesh, then am I truly allowing His innocence, simplicity, and oneness with the Father the opportunity to exhibit itself in me??? What was true of the virgin Mary in the history of the Son of God's birth on earth is true of every born again believer. God's Son is born into me through the direct act of God. ~~~ So then, I as His child must exercise the right of a child ~ the right of always being face to face with my Father through prayer. do I find myself continually saying in amazement to the common sense part of my life, "Why did You want me to turn here or to go over there? 'Did you not know that I must be about My Fathers business?' " (Lk. 2:49) What ever our circumstance may be, that holy, innocent, and eternal Child must be in contact with His Father. The question that we must asked ourselves is, "Is the Son of God praying in me, bringing honor to the Father, or am I dictating my demands to Him? The more a person knows of the inner life of God's most mature saints, the more he sees what God's purpose really is.
prayer: Dear Lord, fill up in my flesh what is lacking in the afflictions of Christ. Amen.

The man did not understand that he would be even more secure if he followed Jesus than he was with all his wealth. Jesus does not ask believers to sell everything they have, although this may be His will for some. But, He does ask us all, to get rid of everything that has become more important in our life than God. IF your possessions take first place in your life, it would be better for you to get rid of them.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to always put You first in my life. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Peace I leave with you, My peace I give to you. ."  (Jn. 14:27)
reflection: I'm afraid that our peace often is based simply on our own ignorance. But when we are awakened to the realities of life, true inner peace is impossible unless it is received from Jesus. When our Lord speaks peace, He creates peace, because the words He speaks are always, "spirit, and they are life" (Jn. 6:63). Are you severely troubled right now? ~ Are you afraid and confused by the waves and the turbulence God sovereignly allows to enter your life? Have you left no stone of your faith unturned, yet still not found any well of peace, joy, or comfort? ~ Does your life seem completely barren to you? ~ Then its time to look up and receive the quiet contentment of the Lord Jesus. ~ Reflecting His peace is proof that you are right with God, because you are exhibiting the freedom to turn you mind to Him. If you are not right with God, you can never turn your mind anywhere but on yourself. If there is a problem pressing in on you right now, are you "looking unto Jesus" (Heb. 12:2) and receiving peace from Him? Lay everything out before Him, and when you are faced with difficulty, bereavement, and sorrow, listen to Him say, "Let not your heart be troubled."
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to always look to You for my peace of mind. Amen.

prayer: Dear Lord, help me to be a useful vessel for You. Amen.
